intro: Cnidoscolus longipes, commonly known as the longipes arrowhead, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its arrow-shaped leaves, which are often hairy and have a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically green or yellowish in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in rainforests. Due to its unique foliage, it is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant.
